issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network

content.raw:
@T_AL sure that could work, but it means our primary nodes for walking will have to be on the sim computer, since those trajectory messages need world frame.  In that scenario, we have to create custom ROS messages to interact with our ROS nodes, which is doable but is a big kludge.  Furthermore, if those nodes have issues, we are going to have to bring them down and back up on the sim computer from the remote computer.
It can be done, but it won't be pretty, and we need to know very soon if that is going to be necessary.
